hwordcloud 0.1.0

    Rendering word clouds using R + Highcharts

    Zhenxing Cheng

    2019-07-14

    hwordcloud.Rmd

    Introduction

    The htmlwidgets package is very interesting and powerful. All the time, I want write my own html widgets, but I failed. This is my third try, finally I success! and the hwordcloud package come out. As I first try using htmlwidgets, I hope you will tolerate some of the flaws of this R package, and I will improve it in the future. Next, let’s use hwordcloud!

    First, you can install it from github:

    devtools::install_github('czxa/hwordcloud')
# or just use git
devtools::install_git("https://github.com/czxa/hwordcloud.git")

    Also, I made a Shiny App for this package:

    dir <- system.file("examples", "hwordcloud", package = "hwordcloud")
setwd(dir)
shiny::shinyAppDir(".")

    Enjoy your use!

    Get Started

    A Basic example

    We can use wordcloud2’s datesets to demonstrate：

    library(hwordcloud)
library(wordcloud2)
library(magrittr)
df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "200px")

    Theme Parameter

    I hate complex codes, so I built some themes in this package. Just change theme parameter, you can render wordcloud in different apperance.

    darkgreen

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "darkgreen")

    darkblue

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "darkblue")

    avocado

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "avocado")

    darkunica

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "darkunica")

    gray

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "gray")

    gridlight

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "gridlight")

    grid

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "grid")

    sandsignika

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "sandsignika")

    sunset

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "300px",
           theme = "sunset")

    Other Parameter

    Title and subtitle are also can be customized.

    A complete example:

    df <- demoFreq %>%
  head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
           width = "100%", height = "200px",
           theme = "sunset",
           title = "Word Cloud",
           titleAlign = "center",
           titleColor = "#333333",
           titleSize = "20px",
           subtitle = "czxa.top",
           subtitleColor = "#666666",
           subtitleAlign = "center",
           subtitleSize = "16px")

    Use hwordcloud in R Markdown

    Benifit from htmlwidgets, you can use hwordcloud() function in R Markdown document. For example, you can create a github document and code following codes in it, save it as a .Rmd documents, then knit it, you will find a word cloud embedded in it.

    df <- demoFreq %>%
      head(50)
hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq, 
               width = "100%", height = "400px",
               theme = "sunset",
               title = "Word Cloud",
               titleAlign = "center",
               titleColor = "#333333",
               titleSize = "20px",
               subtitle = "czxa.top",
               subtitleColor = "#666666",
               subtitleAlign = "center",
               subtitleSize = "16px")

    Use hwordcloud in R Shiny

    Here is a very simple shiny example:

    library(shiny)
library(magrittr)
library(test)
library(wordcloud2)
ui <- fluidPage(
    titlePanel("Highcharter word cloud example"),
    mainPanel(
      hwordcloudOutput("shinytest", height = "500px")
    )
)
server <- function(input, output) {
    df <- demoFreq %>%
        head(50)
    output$shinytest <- renderHwordcloud({
        hwordcloud(text = df$word, size = df$freq)
    })
}
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
